intro: Thelasis cycloglossa, commonly known as the cycloglossa thistle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and yellowish to reddish flower heads. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant's structure includes a robust stem with upright growth, and its flowers are typically arranged in a composite head. Thelasis cycloglossa is often used in ornamental gardening due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
